Nightlight: nightlight waited Rodimus hoping that she has taken the right =
desition.
 > To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
> From: supercyclonus@...
> D=
ate: Thu, 1 Sep 2011 05:42:42 -0400
> Subject: Re: Lessons to be Learned - =
Rodimus
> 
> > Tucson's reply comes back to Nightlight but in a rather mean=
ingful way.
> >
> > " Master Yokitron always told me to have a great respec=
t for fate and where
> > it takes your companions and yourself." I respect =
your wishes and I will see
> > that Elita is safe and that no hand will eve=
r come to harm her. But most of
> > all, be careful and best of luck follow=
ing the road that fate has shown you
> > as it shows everyone when destiny =
calls you forth."
> 
> OOC: The above reply/conversation cannot have happen=
ed. Please keep in
> mind that for the Maximals and Predacons (and Autobots=
 and
> Decepticons) Those inside the jungle CANNOT communicate with those
>=
 outside of it. All comlinks, messages and uplinks have been cut off.
> 
> =
> <OLD>
> >
> >  Nighlgiht left the base and flew a way. When she landed an=
d let her
> > signature appear, she hoped that Dark Rodimus could track her=
.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> OOC: I am going to assume that Nightlight went a good dis=
tance away.
> At least an hour's flight time.
> 
> At first there is nothin=
g but silence and emptiness that greets
> NIGHTLIGHT as she waits for the i=
nevitable to happen. The day is
> beginning to pass as the noonday sun has =
traveled over head and is
> begining to sink towards the horizon.
> 
> Then=
 in the distance a trail of dust as some sort of large vehicle
> approached=
 NIGHTLIGHT. It was one that was easily recognizable to
> NIGHTLIGHT as she=
 had seen it hundreds of times before. It was the
> contrail of dust and de=
bris that RODIMUS kicked up as he travelled
> across the terrain. However n=
ow instead of the familiar reds and
> yellows of RODIMUS this was the black=
 and greys of DARK RODIMUS as he
> aproached in vehicular mode!
> 
> He was=
 still some distance away but he was closing fast!
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
